snippet: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan, a Republican, on Thursday vetoed gun legislation that was supported by the N.R.A. because he said the package could expose domestic abuse victims to additional violence.
abstract: Gov Rick Snyder of Michigan vetoes controversial gun legislation, saying it would allow those accused of domestic abuse to obtain concealed pistol licenses; decision comes despite intense pressure from National Rifle Assn, which endorsed Snyder in last election, and approval by wide margins in State Legislature.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan, a Republican, on Thursday vetoed gun legislation that was supported by the N.R.A. because he said the package could expose domestic abuse victims to additional violence.

headline.main: Governor of Michigan Vetoes Bill on Guns
headline.print_headline: Governor of Michigan Vetoes Bill on Guns
